intro: Epinetrum apiculatum, commonly known as the white-flowered nettle, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other nettle species known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and small, white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Epinetrum apiculatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
